<text>   [24][quote_icon.png] Cite</text>
<text></text>
<text>A Reading on the Dilemma of the Woman in Thackerayâ€™s Vanity Fair through the</text>
<text>Reader-Response Criticism</text>
<text></text>
<text>   [25]Year 2020, Volume: 10 Issue: 2, 104 - 120, 31.12.2020</text>
<text></text>
<text>   [26]Hilal KAYA</text>
<text></text>
<text>Abstract</text>
<text></text>
<text>   William Makepeace Thackeray created two opposite female characters in</text>
<text>   Vanity Fair: A Novel without A Hero (1853), who the Victorian Era</text>
<text>   considered â€œgoodâ€ and â€œbadâ€ and questioned the concepts of good and</text>
<text>   evil during this period. However, despite all his questioning, it is</text>
<text>   uncertain whether his choice was in the direction of the passive,</text>
<text>   docile but boring female character, which is the â€œgoodâ€ female type,</text>
<text>   Amelia, or in the direction of the lively, rebellious but attractive</text>
<text>   female character, the â€œbadâ€ female type, Rebecca. Although this</text>
<text>   attitude of Thackeray can be seen in almost all of his novels, it is</text>
<text>   most evident in Vanity Fair throughout the relationship between Rebecca</text>
<text>   (or Becky) and Amelia. The aim of this study is to examine Becky Sharp,</text>
<text>   one of the important novel characters in Thackeray's Vanity Fair from</text>
<text>   the lens provided by the Reader Response Criticism. In the first part</text>
<text>   of the study, an interrogation about how Thackeray's novel people are</text>
<text>   introduced to the reader will be provided; in the second part, the</text>
<text>   character named Becky Sharp will be examined in terms of the social</text>
<text>   dilemma in detail. Thackeray examines the place and role of women in</text>
<text>   Victorian England, and criticizes the values of the Victorian Period</text>
<text>   based on the lives of the main female characters, Becky and Amelia in</text>
<text>   Vanity Fair. This study, as a result, underlines the fact that</text>
<text>   Thackeray in Vanity Fair questions the concepts of goodness and evil of</text>
<text>   the 19th century England, as he was greatly influenced by 18th century</text>
<text>   master satire writers.</text>
<text></text>
<text>Keywords</text>
<text></text>
<text>   [27]William Makepeace Thackeray, [28]Vanity Fair, [29]Reader-Response</text>
<text>   Criticism, [30]Satire, [31]Victorian Era</text>
<text></text>

<text>   [32]Year 2020, Volume: 10 Issue: 2, 104 - 120, 31.12.2020</text>

<text>   [33]Hilal KAYA</text>

<text>AlanyazÄ±ndaki Ã–rgÃ¼tsel Gurur Ã‡alÄ±ÅŸmalarÄ±nÄ±n Ä°Ã§erik Analizi YÃ¶ntemi Ä°le</text>
<text>Ä°ncelenmesi</text>
<text></text>
<text>   Thumbnail</text>
<text></text>
<text>View/Open</text>
<text></text>
<text>   [20]AraÅŸtÄ±rma Makalesi (427.0Kb)</text>
<text></text>
<text>Access</text>
<text></text>
<text>   info:eu-repo/semantics/openAccess</text>
<text></text>

<text></text>
<text>Author</text>

<text>   [22]Durmaz, Merve GÃ¶zde</text>

<text>Citation</text>
<text></text>
<text>   Durmaz, M. G. &amp; Arda, B. (2021). Ã–RGÃœTSEL GURURUN KAVRAMSAL VE KURAMSAL</text>
<text>   Ã‡ERÃ‡EVESÄ° ÃœZERÄ°NE BÄ°R DEÄERLENDÄ°RME . Management and Political Sciences</text>
<text>   Review , 2 (2) , 1-33</text>
<text></text>
<text>Abstract</text>
<text></text>
<text>   Ä°nsan, doÄŸasÄ± gereÄŸi Ã§eÅŸitli Ã§evresel faktÃ¶rlerden etkilenen ve kendisi</text>
<text>   etkileyen faktÃ¶rleri duygularÄ± ile ÅŸekillendirebilen bir varlÄ±ktÄ±r. Bu</text>
<text>   duygulardan birisi de gururdur. Ã‡alÄ±ÅŸma ortamÄ±nda da insanÄ±n etkilenen</text>
<text>   ve etkileyen konumu devam etmektedir. DolayÄ±sÄ±yla gurur Ã¶rgÃ¼tsel bir</text>
<text>   boyut ve Ã¶nem kazanmaktadÄ±r. AyrÄ±ca Ã¶rgÃ¼tsel gurur iÅŸletmedeki insan</text>
<text>   kaynaÄŸÄ±nÄ±n olumlu davranÄ±ÅŸlarda bulunmasÄ±nÄ± saÄŸlayan Ã¶nemli bir</text>
<text>   faktÃ¶rdÃ¼r. Bu baÄŸlamda Ã§alÄ±ÅŸma kapsamÄ±nda uluslararasÄ± literatÃ¼r</text>
<text>   Ã§erÃ§evesinde Ã¶rgÃ¼tsel gururun kavramsal ve kuramsal Ã§erÃ§evesi</text>
<text>   incelenerek; Ã¶rgÃ¼tsel gururun oluÅŸmasÄ±na katkÄ± saÄŸlayan bireysel ve</text>
<text>   Ã¶rgÃ¼tsel Ã¶ncellerin ortaya konulmasÄ± ve uluslararasÄ± alanyazÄ±nda</text>
<text>   Ã¶rgÃ¼tsel gurur ile ilgili yapÄ±lmÄ±ÅŸ ampirik Ã§alÄ±ÅŸmalarÄ±n iÃ§erik analizi</text>
<text>   yÃ¶ntemi ile ele alÄ±nmasÄ± amaÃ§lanmÄ±ÅŸtÄ±r. Bu kapsamda 2010-2020 yÄ±llarÄ±</text>
<text>   arasÄ±nda literatÃ¼rde yayÄ±nlanmÄ±ÅŸ 25 uluslararasÄ± makale incelenmiÅŸtir.</text>
<text></text>
<text>   Human beings, by their nature, are affected by various environmental</text>
<text>   factors and can shape the factors that affect them with their emotions.</text>
<text>   One of these emotions is pride. The affected and affecting position of</text>
<text>   the human being in the working environment continues. Therefore, pride</text>
<text>   gains an organizational dimension and importance. In addition,</text>
<text>   organizational pride is an important factor that enables the human</text>
<text>   resources in the business to behave positively. In this context, by</text>
<text>   examining the conceptual and theoretical framework of organizational</text>
<text>   pride within the framework of international literature within the scope</text>
<text>   of the study; It is aimed to reveal the individual and organizational</text>
<text>   predecessors that contribute to the formation of organizational pride</text>
<text>   and to examine the empirical studies conducted on organizational pride</text>
<text>   in the international literature with the method of content analysis. In</text>
<text>   this context, 25 international articles published in the literature</text>
<text>   between 2010-2020 were analyzed</text>
<text></text>
<text>URI</text>
<text></text>
<text>   [24]https://dergipark.org.tr/tr/pub/mpsr/issue/60022/836410</text>
<text>   [25]https://hdl.handle.net/20.500.12428/3344</text>
<text></text>

<text>   Gururunu sevdiÄŸinle kaybetmek o sevdiÄŸini gereksiz gururunla</text>
<text>   kaybetmekten iyidir. - John Ruskin</text>
<text></text>
<text>Gurur ile ilgili sÃ¶zler</text>
<text></text>
<text>   Bu sayfada gurur ile ilgili sÃ¶zler bulacaksÄ±nÄ±z.</text>
<text>   DevamÄ±nÄ± Oku</text>
<text>   [INS: :INS]</text>
<text></text>
<text>   Gurursuz insanlarÄ±n anlayÄ±ÅŸ beklemesi kadar saÃ§ma bir hayat...</text>
<text></text>
<text>   Sevemeyecek kadar soÄŸuk, piÅŸman olamayacak kadar gurursuzsun.</text>
<text></text>
<text>   Sana karÅŸÄ± gurursuz ve yÃ¼zsÃ¼z olduÄŸum iÃ§in tek kez piÅŸman olmadÄ±m,</text>
<text>   Ã§Ã¼nkÃ¼ ben seni sevdim, yaptÄ±ÄŸÄ±m ayÄ±p deÄŸildi.</text>
<text></text>

<text>   Gurur, TÃ¼rkÃ§ede iki farklÄ± konotasyona sahip olan bir sÃ¶zcÃ¼ktÃ¼r.</text>
<text>   Negatif konotasyon, en basit tanÄ±mÄ±yla kibir ve kendini beÄŸenme</text>

<text>Negatif anlamÄ±[[179]deÄŸiÅŸtir | [180]kaynaÄŸÄ± deÄŸiÅŸtir]</text>

<text>   Kibirlenme, kiÅŸinin kendini baÅŸkalarÄ±yla kÄ±yaslamasÄ± durumudur. SÃ¼rekli</text>

<text>   Gurur duygusunun aÅŸÄ±rÄ±ya kaÃ§masÄ± Ã¶nlenerek takdirin Ã§evreden gelmesi,</text>

<text>Historical Maquettes and Their Functions Rendering Students to be â€˜Historical</text>
<text>Architectâ€™: â€œI Investigate, Practice and I Am Proud of Myselfâ€</text>
<text></text>
<text>   [25]Year 2014, Volume: 4 Issue: 1, 63 - 80, 01.03.2014</text>
<text></text>
<text>   [26]YÃ¼cel KabapÄ±nar [27]TuÄŸba SargÄ±n</text>
<text></text>
<text>Abstract</text>
<text></text>
<text>   Grounded on the constructivist view Turkish educational program</text>
<text>   launched in 2005 requires students to be actively involved in</text>
<text>   learning-teaching process. Thereby, this requirement have found in</text>
<text>   place in the Social Studies Program by stating that â€œstudents are</text>
<text>   expected to create their own products including photographs, pictures,</text>
<text>   paintings, projects, posters, lyrics, powerpoint presentations and</text>
<text>   maquettes and to exhibit them so as to share their products with their</text>
<text>   parents and social environmentâ€. In parallel to this, the present study</text>
<text>   aims to investigate studentsâ€™ feelings about the difficulties that they</text>
<text>   faced in designing the maquettes and their opinions about perceptions</text>
<text>   and skills that they acquired during the process. The participants of</text>
<text>   the study are students who are attending in a state school in KadÄ±kÃ¶y,</text>
<text>   Ä°stanbul. Participants who are seventh and eighth graders planned and</text>
<text>   designed their maquettes in various subjects appeared in the Social</text>
<text>   Studies Program according to their own preferences. An open-ended</text>
<text>   questionnaire were distributed to both students (n=59) and their</text>
<text>   parents (n=28). Additionally, a semi-structured interview was carried</text>
<text>   out with the teacher of the course. The content analysis was benefited</text>
<text>   in sorting out the qualitative data obtained. The results of the study</text>
<text>   revealed that studentsâ€™ preference focused on war-related themes in</text>
<text>   choosing the subject of the maquette. They also showed that students</text>
<text>   benefited visual aids in planning and designing the maquettes. Students</text>
<text>   aired that preparing and displaying their maquettes make them â€œhappyâ€</text>
<text>   and â€œchanged their attitudes towards the social studies course in a</text>
<text>   positive wayâ€</text>
<text></text>
<text>Keywords</text>
<text></text>
<text>   [28]Historical maquette, [29]Social Studies, [30]Constructivism</text>
<text></text>

<text>   Hubris nedir?</text>
<text></text>
<text>   Hubris, aÅŸÄ±rÄ± dÃ¼zeyde gurur, Ã¶zgÃ¼ven ve kibri iÃ§eren bir kiÅŸilik</text>

<text>Gurur Ne Demek, TDK SÃ¶zlÃ¼k AnlamÄ± Nedir? Gururlu Olmak Ne Anlama Gelir?</text>
<text></text>

<text>   [62]#Gurur Ne Demek[63]#Gurur</text>
<text>   TwitterLinkedinFlipboardLinki Kopyala</text>

<text>   Gurur Ne Demek, TDK SÃ¶zlÃ¼k AnlamÄ± Nedir Gururlu Olmak Ne Anlama Gelir</text>
<text></text>
<text>   [64]Gurur kelimesiyle ilgili kurulan Ã§ok fazla sayÄ±da cÃ¼mle bulunuyor.</text>

<text>   Gurur Ne Demek, TDK SÃ¶zlÃ¼k AnlamÄ± Nedir?</text>
